so I've done a number of translations of
the Spanish mystic Saint John of the
Cross in st. Teresa of ávila over the
years and in many other books that are
reflections and responses to the
teachings of the Christian mystics as a
Jewish Sufi Buddhist Hindu agnostic and
finally I wrote a book called God of

Christianity and Islam in which I was
following kind of two streams the the
mystical stream in the Abrahamic faiths
and the social justice stream and I I
organised that that book into twelve

topics in those religions like
stewardship of the earth or the feminine
face of God and in each chapter I told a
story from my own life my editor
encouraged me to do this and everyone's

stories and I feel that way when I read
other people's work I just want another
story I don't want theories I think I've
already probably established I had this
allergy to conceptual constructs that

put the mystery in a box but I love

write a memoir about what the experience

and how the teachings of the dark night
